intro: Silene atocioides, commonly known as the purple sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene atocioides is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh, windy conditions.
